Package com.bhoffpauir.blisp.lib

Class NumberAtom

java.lang.Object
com.bhoffpauir.blisp.lib.Atom<Double>
com.bhoffpauir.blisp.lib.NumberAtom
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<NumberAtom>
public class NumberAtom extends Atom<Double> implements Comparable<NumberAtom>
Atom representation for numbers in blisp.

This class encapsulates numeric values, primarily represented as Double by default. It can be expanded to support other number types by switching to a Number base type in the future.

Number representations can handle integer and floating-point formats, including optional scientific notation.

Example valid numbers:

  • 123
  • -456.789
  • 3.14e+10

This class also implements Comparable to allow comparisons between number atoms, and it provides pattern matching to validate number formats.

See Also:

  • Double
